Title.evidence: A Systematic Review of Supraglottic Airway Devices for Blind Endotracheal Intubation: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation methods and allocation concealment were assessed

Participants.evidence: The study setting included various countries, and participants were anesthesiologists, paramedics, and other healthcare professionals.

Intervention.evidence: The Fastrach Intubating Laryngeal Mask Airway (LMA Fastrach), i-gel, Air-Q, and S.A.L.T. were the most used SGDs.

Objective.evidence: This study aims to evaluate the effectiveness of supraglottic airway devices (SGDs) for blind endotracheal intubation (ETI) in patients under general anesthesia and simulation manikins.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcomes were the success rate of blind ETI and intubation time.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation methods and allocation concealment were assessed

Result_Outcome.evidence: SGDs with the highest overall success rates were i-gel, S.A.L.T., LMA Fastrach, and single-use LMA Fastrach, achieving success rates greater than 90%.
